questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

questions.question: Which tag is used to define a paragraph?
questions.explanation:
The

tag defines a paragraph in HTML. Paragraphs are block-level elements that automatically add some space before and after the content.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define an image?
questions.explanation: The tag is used to embed images in an HTML document. It requires the src attribute to specify the image source and should include an alt attribute for accessibility.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML element for the largest heading?
questions.explanation: The <h1> tag defines the largest and most important heading. Headings range from <h1> (most important) to <h6> (least important).

questions.question: Which part of the HTML document contains information not displayed on the page?
questions.explanation: The <head> section contains meta-information about the document that isn't displayed on the page, such as the title, character set, styles, scripts, and other meta information.
